shots.name: Extreme Wide Shot (EWS)
shots.description: Used to show the subject's surroundings. The subject is often barely visible. Often used as an establishing shot.

guidance_steps.step: Frame a vast location.
Place your subject in the frame so they are small.
Record to establish the scene.

shots.name: Wide Shot / Long Shot (WS/LS)
shots.description: Shows the entire subject from head to toe, with their surroundings still visible.

guidance_steps.step: Frame your subject from head to toe.
Use the guides to ensure their whole body is in the shot.
Record the subject's action.

shots.name: Full Shot (FS)
shots.description: A shot that frames the entire body of the subject, from head to toe, with the framing being a bit tighter than a wide shot.

guidance_steps.step: Frame your subject from head to toe.
Ensure their entire body is visible.
Record the subject.

shots.name: Medium Long Shot (MLS)
shots.description: Frames the subject from roughly the knees up. Also known as a 3/4 shot.

guidance_steps.step: Frame your subject from the knees up.
Use the guides to check framing.
Record the subject.

shots.name: Cowboy Shot
shots.description: A variation of a medium shot that frames the subject from mid-thighs up, so a cowboy's holsters would be visible.

guidance_steps.step: Frame your subject from the mid-thigh up.
Imagine they are about to draw a pistol.
Record the subject.

shots.name: Medium Shot (MS)
shots.description: Shows the subject from the waist up. One of the most common shots.

guidance_steps.step: Frame the subject from the waist up.
Use guides to perfect framing.
Record the conversation or action.

shots.name: Medium Close-Up (MCU)
shots.description: Frames a subject from the chest or shoulders up.

guidance_steps.step: Frame the subject from the chest up.
Focus on the subject's face and expression.
Record the emotion.

shots.name: Close-Up (CU)
shots.description: Fills the screen with the subject's face, showing detail and emotion.

guidance_steps.step: Frame the subject's face.
Use guides to frame the face correctly.
Record the subtle expressions.

shots.name: Extreme Close-Up (ECU)
shots.description: Frames a specific detail of the subject, such as their eyes or mouth.

guidance_steps.step: Choose a single facial feature.
Frame only that feature.
Record for dramatic effect.

shots.name: Single Shot
shots.description: A shot that features only one character.

guidance_steps.step: Frame a single subject.
Ensure no other characters are prominent.
Record the subject.

shots.name: Two Shot
shots.description: A shot featuring two characters, often used for conversations.

guidance_steps.step: Frame two subjects in the shot.
Use guides to ensure both faces are detected.
Record the interaction.

shots.name: Over the Shoulder Shot
shots.description: A shot of someone taken from the shoulder of another person.

guidance_steps.step: Position camera behind one person's shoulder.
Frame the other person.
Record the conversation.

shots.name: Over the Hip Shot
shots.description: A shot taken from behind a character's hip, often used in westerns. mostly similar to cowboy shot but sot from behind

guidance_steps.step: Position camera near the character's hip.
Frame the scene from this low perspective.
Record the action.

shots.name: Point of View Shot (POV)
shots.description: Shows what a character is looking at, as if from their eyes.

guidance_steps.step: Position the camera at the character's eye level.
Imagine you are the character.
Record the scene from their perspective.

shots.name: Eye Level Shot
shots.description: The camera is placed at the subject's eye level, creating a neutral effect.

guidance_steps.step: Position camera at subject's eye level.
Keep the camera level.
Record for a neutral, natural feel.

shots.name: Low Angle Shot
shots.description: The camera is placed low, looking up, making the subject look powerful.

guidance_steps.step: Position camera below subject's eye level.
Tilt the camera upwards.
Record to create a sense of power.

shots.name: High Angle Shot
shots.description: The camera is placed high, looking down, making the subject look vulnerable.

guidance_steps.step: Position camera above subject's eye level.
Tilt the camera downwards.
Record to create a sense of vulnerability.

shots.name: Dutch Angle / Dutch Tilt
shots.description: The camera is tilted on its axis, creating a sense of unease or disorientation.

guidance_steps.step: Frame your subject.
Tilt the camera 15-30 degrees.
Record to create a feeling of unease.

shots.name: Bird's Eye View / Overhead
shots.description: A shot looking directly down on a scene from above.

guidance_steps.step: Position the camera directly overhead.
Ensure the camera is pointing straight down.
Record to provide a unique overview of the scene.

shots.name: Aerial Shot
shots.description: A shot taken from the air, typically from a helicopter or drone.

guidance_steps.step: Use a drone for this shot.
Fly the drone to a high altitude.
Record an establishing or travel shot.

shots.name: Pan Shot
shots.description: The camera moves horizontally from a fixed position.

guidance_steps.step: Fix your camera's position on a tripod.
Rotate the camera smoothly left or right.
Record to reveal a scene or follow a subject.

shots.name: Tilt Shot
shots.description: The camera moves vertically from a fixed position.

guidance_steps.step: Fix your camera's position on a tripod.
Rotate the camera smoothly up or down.
Record to reveal an object or character.

shots.name: Dolly Shot
shots.description: The entire camera moves forward or backward, often on a track.

guidance_steps.step: Mount camera on a wheeled device (dolly, slider).
Move the camera smoothly towards or away from the subject.
Record to create a sense of movement and depth.

shots.name: Zoom Shot
shots.description: The camera lens is used to zoom in or out, changing the focal length.

guidance_steps.step: Frame your subject.
Use the zoom controls to smoothly zoom in or out.
Record to focus attention on a detail.

shots.name: Dolly Zoom / Vertigo Shot
shots.description: The camera dollies in or out while the lens zooms in the opposite direction.

guidance_steps.step: This is a very advanced shot!
Dolly the camera towards the subject while zooming out.
Record to create a sense of unease or revelation.

shots.name: Tracking Shot
shots.description: The camera moves alongside the subject.

guidance_steps.step: Move the camera parallel to your subject's movement.
Keep the subject in the same part of the frame.
Record to follow the action.

shots.name: Arc Shot
shots.description: The camera moves in a circular path around the subject.

guidance_steps.step: Move the camera in a semi-circle around your subject.
Keep the subject in the center of the frame.
Record to add dynamism to the scene.

shots.name: Rack Focus / Focus Pull
shots.description: Changing the focus of the lens from one subject to another during a shot.

guidance_steps.step: Set your focus on one subject.
Smoothly shift the focus to another subject.
Record to shift the audience's attention.

shots.name: Shallow Focus
shots.description: One part of the image is in focus while the rest is out of focus (blurry).

guidance_steps.step: Use a wide aperture (low f-stop number).
Focus precisely on your subject.
Record to isolate your subject from the background.

shots.name: Deep Focus
shots.description: Everything in the frame, from foreground to background, is in sharp focus.

guidance_steps.step: Use a narrow aperture (high f-stop number).
Ensure you have plenty of light.
Record to show all the detail in the scene.

shots.name: Tilt-Shift
shots.description: Rotates the lens plane relative to the image plane, creating a very narrow band of focus.

guidance_steps.step: Requires a special tilt-shift lens.
Adjust the tilt to select a plane of focus.
Record to create a miniaturized look.

shots.name: Handheld Shot
shots.description: The camera is held by the operator, resulting in a shaky, kinetic feel.

guidance_steps.step: Hold the camera firmly.
Allow for some natural movement and shake.
Record to create a sense of urgency or realism.

shots.name: Steadicam Shot
shots.description: Using a camera stabilizer to create smooth, floating camera movements.

guidance_steps.step: Requires a Steadicam or similar gimbal rig.
Balance the camera on the rig.
Walk smoothly to create a floating effect.

shots.name: Crane or Jib Shot
shots.description: The camera is mounted on a crane or jib to move vertically through space.

guidance_steps.step: Mount the camera on a crane or jib.
Move the arm of the crane up or down.
Record to create dramatic reveals or high-angle shots.

shots.name: Drone Shot
shots.description: A shot taken from a camera mounted on a drone, essentially a modern aerial shot.

guidance_steps.step: Use a camera drone.
Fly the drone to capture sweeping vistas or follow action.
Record for breathtaking aerial perspectives.
